## GAD-7 vs ECBQ

The comparison between Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and Early Childhood Behaviour Questionnaire (ECBQ) can seem daunting, owing to the different formats, language, and terminologies used within these scales. However, with Harmony, the process of comparing GAD-7 and ECBQ becomes incredibly streamlined, thanks to its powerful natural language processing and generative AI models. Through Harmony's algorithm, a percentage match between each item in GAD-7 and ECBQ can be obtained, providing researchers with a comparative overview quickly and effectively. Harmony not only supports comparison in one language but operates on multiple languages, thereby opening up possibilities for cross-cultural research in psychology and social sciences. By using Harmony, GAD-7 and ECBQ can be easily contrasted, alleviating the need for manual harmonization and making the process more objective and time-efficient. Simply upload instruments from your existing database or drag and drop PDF forms into the easy-to-use Harmony web interface. The task of comparing GAD-7 and ECBQ gets redefined with Harmony. Its advanced capabilities ensure that researchers can focus on what matters most - interpreting the associations and unexplored patterns within and across these scales. Whether it is the GAD-7 examination of general anxiety or the ECBQ's inspection of early childhood behavior, Harmony's cross-comparison feature aids psychologists in making critical connections across these instruments. So, for your next GAD-7 vs ECBQ comparison task, leverage the technology at your fingertips and tap into the potential of Harmony.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and ECBQ

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#_" target="harmonyapp">Import just ECBQ into Harmony</a> - compare ECBQ with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
